Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: 6AE
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed here one night in October, booked a standard room, got upgraded to a superior, loved it! Great room, great service. A month later we booked another night at Perak hotel, they only had a deluxe room, but we were confident that it would be well worth the money. We arrived after midnight and received a noisy hole in the wall as a deluxe room with no option to switch to another room (the hotel was fully booked). Next morning we complained to the manager and even though we got refunded the price difference between the deluxe and the superior room, it didn't make us feel any better. Would I recommend this place to a friend? No way!! Singapore is a wonderful city with lots of hotels to choose from, so you can easily find something much better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: Gerry1111
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Singapore, and I initially found the choice of hotels confusing. This one is in the medium price range, I booked with Agoda for around £ 70 per night. In hindsight I would have preferred not to stay in Little India, however once you get the hang of the MRT, your location is less important. The hotel is only a 5 min walk to either Little India (for Chinatown / City Centre) or Bugis (for the airport etc) stations. The rooms are small, and the bathrooms are smaller, all very clean though. They appear to have a problem with noise / loud music from the venue downstairs - this went on until around 4 am. As mentioned in other reviews, the breakfasts are fairly minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Small, Good service”
Reviews.Author: paulie1616
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days while we visited Singapore, en route to Bali. The hotel is located in Little India, about 20+/- minutes from the airport ($30 cab ride). The hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful and nice. They spoke good English. The subway/metro stop was about 5 minutes away. We had three people in our group. While there were three beds in the room, they were all side by side, resembling one large bed made up of three twin beds. The pillows were perfect. The air conditioning unit worked VERY well. So well that I got cold and there weren't enough blankets in the room! The breakfast is meager. There was always cereal (corn flakes or the like), sandwich bread, jam, and hard-boiled eggs. While they had fruit every day, it was always some form of melon. They had water, orange juice, and milk. They also had yogurt. The bathroom is small. The shower nozzle is literally right above the sink, so you shower in the same space where you wash your hands. One would not really be able to shower and someone else use the bathroom at the same time. It was a quiet hotel. Not the kind of place for 20-somethings wanting to party. All in all, a very nice hotel! Oh, and if you're there on a Sunday night, be prepared for the hoardes of Indian men who come out to socialize on their day off. The women stay in. Go to Ganga Indian Restaurant for some amazing Indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Neat & Clean, friendly accommodation - 3 Star property”
Reviews.Author: rsoodmail
Reviews.Content: Booked though booking.com but I advised you to check with hotel directly to get good tariff. Situated in Little India & close to China town. Good Restaurants are in walking distance ( Veg / Non-Veg). An Indian Discotheque is near by where you can see local tamilan crowd until late hours. Reception staff is very humble and friendly. They will go extra mile to make you feel comfortable. Even they offer you to fill your water bottle. Breakfast was good. I took rooms with 3 bed for 2 nights. Next 2-nights we stayed in Sentosa. Rooms are smaller but very nicely kept & maintained. I paid around 233 S$ ( inclusive of taxes-BBF) / night which I feel is quite OK as compared to other hotels viewed over internet. They have used single inch of the space to accomodate everything. Free WIFI in all the floors but signal is strong only if you use cable to your laptop. For hand devices you need to come to lobby or passage inorder to connect well to the internet. Taxi fare to known places like Zoo, Night Safari, Bird Park are well in range of 20-30 S$ thus I did'nt use metro/ rail while in singapore. I would definitely go next time & recommend for those who are looking for such facility in this particular area.

Reviews.Title: “Budget option in character location”
Reviews.Author: betsymarge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before joining a cruise. Hotel is 5 or 10 minutes walk from Little India MRT. It is a good budget option in a very expensive city, but really more like a hostal. Room was small but bed comfortable. Breakfast adequate. Staff were nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A TASTE OF INDIA”
Reviews.Author: haigo86
Reviews.Content: the perak hotel is located in the most exciting area of singapore , little india , colonial buildings abound , decorated in the vibrant colours of india . in the evenings the streets come alive with hundreds of indian men and women walking the streets , chatting and eating in fabulous and authentic cafes . the perak hotel is a beautifull land mark colonial building ,smack bang in the middle off the action . the hotel offers clean comfortable rooms with attentive staff at affortable prices with a more than adequate breakfast , great place to stay and suck up the incredible vibe off little india , all this is in walking distance off central singapore .

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jessicam_hk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Perak hotel. We stayed in a Deluxe room - very compact but spotlessly clean and nice decor. The room included tea and coffee making facilities, TV, minibar and quiet A/C. Rooms have free wired internet access and there's free Wifi in the public areas. We loved the location - Little India is one of our favorite parts of Singapore and this hotel is only 10 minutes walk from the MRT, close to bus routes to major tourist destinations and plenty of great food options within a couple of minutes walk. We weren't bothered by the noise from the nearby club that others have mentioned, however the morning call from the mosque is quite loud! Breakfast was fine, fairly basic - cereal, toast, juices etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again next time we're in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: varoojan13
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff that had us upgraded to a Deluxe room for two nights. We stayed in a standard room for one night. No difference in size between the rooms. But the Deluxe ones have better views and a minibar. Clean rooms. Breakfast basic, but pretty good. Coffee tasted like water. Location pretty good. 550 m walk from Little India Metro station. The AC didn't feel good. Hard to find a good level of coolness, it was either blasting storms or we had to turn it off in between. Cheap model? Overall everyting average. Really expensive if located in another country, but in Singapore measures, just fine. Streets outside could be noisy. Would recommend, if you don't mind the TINY rooms. Had barely room for our bags. PS. 2-3 rooms at the first floor didn't have any windows. room 108-110??

Reviews.Title: “Staff Attention makes up for anything else that may be missing”
Reviews.Author: aungkhant
Reviews.Content: I had arrived from Paris after a long flight and after the friendly chinese taxi driver had dropped me off at Perak Hotel, the front desk manager Murali welcomed as if we were old friends. Rooms were as expected in size and devoid of the noises outside the hotel. The next morning Benny the day time manager was more than willing to provide all the answers. Strategically located in Little India, a place I felt more welcome and absorbing than a dirty city like Bangalore in India itself, you could be part of the carnival for the night. My only complaint is about Breakfast. Even by US standards where the food is not up to par in modest hotels, this was bad. White bread, hydrogenated oils and artifical food, noodles out of package.. but then again, with so much excellent breakfast places around, who would want to eat this food, go out and enjoy a nice idli set or dosai or any number of south indian dishes..

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Experience in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Julie255115
Reviews.Content: When returning from a holiday in Vietnam we organised a four day stay in Singapore. We wanted to experience a more authentic Singapore than Orchard Road so we booked into the Perak Hotel in Little India. This hotel was just what we wanted, it was close to two "people mover" rail stations, Bugis and Little India, it was within walking distance of Sim Lim Tower for our computer/camera needs and was surrounded by lots of little eateries and restaurants. At night the whole area "buzzed" with people, food, colour and shops. We loved it. The price included breakfast which we could eat outside on the little tables in the cooler morning temperatues or inside. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were spotlessly clean and met our needs perfectly. Singapore is easy to get around and with the nearness of the railstations, Orchard Road and other parts of Singapore are only a short railride away. Little India is one part of Singapore that is not to be missed for its vibrancy and culture, a little glimpse of Singapore's historic past. Nearby are mosques, temples and old shophouses, a wonderful mix of old world ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Shame about the club next door”
Reviews.Author: Saigon_Twin
Reviews.Content: The guy who works here had won me over within 2 minutes of arriving. He was warm, helpful and funny. The rooms are comfortable, with wooden floors and powerful AC. The location is perfect, right in the middle of Little India - cheap curry and friendly faces. The only downside to this hotel is the nightclub next door. I was kept awake until 2am every night but this may have been due to the fact it was Chinese New Year and SIngapore was in full celebration! Overall, I'm very happy I chose this hotel and would recommend it. But maybe ask for a room at the opposite end of the corridor, away from the club.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of everything”
Reviews.Author: Ramenologist
Reviews.Content: It was the first time our family went out of the country, so I was really looking forward to a cheap yet convenient place for us to stay, at least for the first two nights. We stayed at the Sentosa Festive Hotel on the last day. I was choosing between Perak Hotel and the chic Saff Hotel. But since Perak offered a room with three beds, it was a pretty easy option. Perak is situated in Little India. Though the place itself stinks, you'd see that it all adds up to the unique experience in Singapore. The area outside is generally dirty, with the cheap restaurants, and the marketplace a few steps away. The hotel room was clean, but very small. It felt as if three beds were forced inside a room for one. The bathroom was small too. It has a shower, right beside the toilet bowl, and everything else. Staff were not unfriendly, but they were rather quiet and they talk less. I don't see how this could add to the minus points, but definitely not a plus. They respond to your questions in sentences four words or less. Ahahah! There was a horse race on one of the nearby restaurants and people from Little India were cheering all night long. That was a bummer. Breakfast buffet was okay. and their dining area was really cute. It was small too, and easily creates a homey-feel for breakfast goers. It sets a mood that there will be a great day ahead of you. Overall, I won't recommend the experience for family trips. There is a long walk from the hotel going to the train station, and it's difficult to let your parents walk that distance. You're better off staying at Resorts World Sentosa for a few extra bucks. But I'd definitely go back here but this time with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Little India”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromnapier
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a 1 night stopover in SIN on our trip to the UK, after choosing the Perak Hotel from the reviews on TA, I must say all those positive reviews came through. This was a good place to stay, friendly and helpful staff and clean linen. My wife and 2 daughters were pleasently surprised at our loft conversion room, it had so much space.

Reviews.Title: “Just the basics”
Reviews.Author: 2815riggs
Reviews.Content: The best quality of Perak is that it's cheap for the location -- it's in Little India, and within 10 minutes walk to Bugis MRT. Singapore hotel rates have gotten out of control, so this is good option if you're looking for a good value and a central location. The rooms are bare, with average cleanliness. My room had a tiny window that provided very little natural light, and a tiny bathroom with an itty bitty shower stall. Breakfast was decent, staff were idiosyncratic (in a sort of family run hotel kind of way), but it does the job if you are here for a short trip and on a tight budget. There are lots of good eats in the area (both Chinese and Indian), and it's in a colorful neighborhood, so step out and explore and get a good local meal, if you are up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel. Compact and unpretentious.”
Reviews.Author: Clare4898
Reviews.Content: our party consisted of three adults. We had a deluxe room with a huge king sized bed and a single. Rooms are small but all hotels are like this in Little India. The staff were friendly and helpful and they serve a basic but good breakfast of cereal, toast, noodles, fruit, tea and coffee. They provide a TV and fridge and tea and coffee making in the rooms and the bathroom is small but perfectly adequate. Hotels ar not cheap in Singapore but this pace was ideal for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Quality of stay depends heavily on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: Taj81
Reviews.Content: We booked well ahead here and arrived late at night. We were shown to a room that looked like a cave with a raised platform for sleeping with mattresses on it and a tiny old bathroom. As it was late we waited until morning to address this. After some negotiation we were given a far superior room albeit a bit noisy. The breakfast is basic and the room becomes very crowded and sometimes hard to get a seat which is annoying if you have a tour booked etc. The woman working in the kitchen is moody and sour and spends most of her time watching the oversized TV loudly playing CNN news. It seems an imposition to ask the kitchen hand for anything. Friends just stayed at Perak recently for the second time and this time were most dissapointed as they were placed in a very noisy room. The location is great but it depends on the room you get as to how much you will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: karhuHelsinki
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel in a vivid and beautiful part of Singapore. The area is packed with bars and restaurants. The hotel is in an old building so it has it´s own character. The service was friendly. I wouls come again.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of Little India”
Reviews.Author: aloisw8
Reviews.Content: Great location in vibrant and colourful Little India...surrounded by restaurants cafes and markets.The hotel is somewhat basic and ok for a short stay...nice shutters but no view beyond the facing brick wall. Staff not particularly friendly but not rude. Breakfast was adequate. Room small and in need of updating...but nice wooden floors. We felt that they were merely providing what you paid for...shame because it could be special here, it's a great location and the surrounding area is truly authentic...away from clinical Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JohninNewburyport
Reviews.Content: When I told our cab driver where we wanted to go he growled "cheap hotel." As a description of the price, that was accurate given Singapore prices, but the quality of the hotel was quite good. The rooms were comfortable, although not especially large, they were very clean and the bed was good. The room had an easy to use safe and the staff were friendly. This hotel is located in Little India, which for me was a plus because it put me in close proximity to plenty of restaurants, including a Madras New Woodlands, serving excellent Indian food. (It is worth strolling through the streets of this neighborhood after dark to get a sense of what Indian cities are like.) Two things to be aware of: there is no elevator so you will have to walk your luggage upstairs to a second or third floor room; and the morning breakfast isn't up to much. But the hotel's other virtues more than compensate. There is a computer in a side room that is available to guests after 7 p.m. and it is possible to make yourself a cup of coffee in the cafe, including decaf!, at any time of the day or night. I was very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel in Interesting area”
Reviews.Author: Kiwisnowbirds
Reviews.Content: A good quality budget hotel advertising itself as boutique style. Place is clean, tidy and well maintained; staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but adequate. We had a ground floor room which was a bit dim and had a bit of noise from the alley right outside the small window. Being in Little India the area can be noisy till pretty late at night but not really a problem inside the hotel. The breakfast is basic European; there is tastier food nearby. The MTR is 5 minutes walk away past the Tekka Food Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: Brompman
Reviews.Content: Good cheap hotel without too many bells and whistles. The rooms are relatively small but did the trick, as we didn't spend all that much time in our hotel. Cleanliness is so-so (mildewy bathroom, stains on the sheets) but adequate. The complimentary breakfast was a welcome addition, but nothing speacial. On the plus side, the service was excellent, especially Alvin (the guy who works days), who was extremely curteous and helpful. The location is also fantastic, right in Little India (try Lagnaa, a great Indian restaurant nearby!), and a 5 minute walk from the subway. Overall, you get what you pay for, but for Singapore this is a good and relatively cheap option.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute budget gem!”
Reviews.Author: razib3002
Reviews.Content: I was there for 5 nights on a business trip this October. I found the service, stuffs and rooms very clean and nice. The rooms are smaller though and what do you expect with the money you are paying for! The location is the one you want to be in. I recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kydeon
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 4 nights at the Perak Hotel. It was just O.K. Room was very small with some mold on the wall and ants for company. Good location but next time I think I will dig a bit deeper into my pocket for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Cozy interior.”
Reviews.Author: ramanando
Reviews.Content: Very nice adress.Well located. Very friendly.Colonial architecture.Good breakfast.We booked a family room and got a huge suite where you almost get lost.

Reviews.Title: “A good value stay”
Reviews.Author: marcodasha3
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and appreciated the good value and central location of this hotel. Very clean, good, fast and friendly service. Rooms are small but clean and tidy. Breakfast buffet is a bit of a let down, a bit more care (overall presentation) towards it would be good. Free wifi is available in the communal areas of the hotel but not in the rooms (why?). All rooms strictly non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackster11
Reviews.Content: A bit like all the other reviews this is a good quality budget hotel. The rooms were clean, bathroom tiny but clean at least. Staff were very friendly and it's in a good location if you want to walk around the Little India area or walk over to the city area. Only stayed here 2 nights and then moved over to something a bit more luxurious but the stay was pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but....”
Reviews.Author: Daryl V
Reviews.Content: The location is not that easy to find. The area is a bit busy and has narrow streets. It was a busy time when we arrived. people were checking in and checking out at the same time. But Alvin was very helpful. he sure was busy but he still managed to be warm and helpful when it was our turn. Hotel interiors have very limited space from lobby to dining area to hallway up to the room. altho the room i must say is clean. nothing to say about breakfast coz honestly, theres almost nothing to eat anyway... it was all bread, cup noodles, boiled eggs and more bread... No wifi in the room just at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but”
Reviews.Author: Resande2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with some real charm and good location in little India. Staff were helpful and knew the art om make us feel very welcome even though we arrived at the same time as many guests were checking in and out. Pretty much inbetween two MRT stations (little India and Bugis) whcih gives you a choice of lines but not really super close to either. Breakfast included fresh cut fruit salad and some hot dishes, basic but good. Little India is lively and there was a bar playing quite loud music till 3:00 every night, we were not particularly bothered, but if you don't like falling a sleep to disco music ask for a romm on the other side of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: 4catzz
Reviews.Content: We throroughly enjoyed our stay at the Perak, tha staff without exception were friendly and helpful. We were woken each morning courtesy of the Mosque opposite calling the faithful to prayer, it didn't bother us, our room was at the front of the Hotel, so if you think the afore mentioned could be an issue, request a room at the back of the hotel. Our room was spotlessly clean and comfortable, everything we needed was there, not that we spaent that much time in the room, we were about and about all day every day, there's so much more to see in Singapore than Orchard Rd! The Perak is well situated for the MRT, little more than 5 minutes walk, past places for eating, and stalls selling all manner of fantastic looking vegetables, wonderful fragrant smells too, from food to incense sticks. We would definately stay at the Perak, with a Colonial style charm all of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: JMMcE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights 9th and 10th Sept. Room was a little dark but roomy, clean and with all the facilities one would expect for the modest price, by Singapore standards. The location is good, although about 7 mins walk to either Bugis or Little India MRTs., the area itself is quite lively if a bit young with the travellers in some of the hostels nearby livening up the pubs. The staff in the hotel were excellent. I must particularly mention Jaylord the night porter who saved me leaving the hotel late at night to do some computor work by allowing me use the hotel facilities FOC. All in all, I will probably return to the PErak on my next Singapore visit.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is really charming, well renovated and a bargain for Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Clarkychili8
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot of charm. The rooms are not large, but really clean and the staff are really effiicient and helpful. I would definitely stay again and it's great to see and support older hotels with historical significance being maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Perak hotel advertises itself as guesthouse - very fitting”
Reviews.Author: LinenBank
Reviews.Content: Perak hotel is a budget hotel in little India. Its location is good and it provides what it promises - a simple room with aircon, toilet, shower and TV. The breakfast is basic, the service is effective and the best of all it is a reputable hotel. You can get a cheaper hotel in Singapore, but those hotels often are used as 'hourly' hotels. The atmosphere in the hotel is quite unique since it is a former shophouse. It is difficult to rate the hotel, because it is targeting a certain niche. It is not a luxury hotel, but it gives a good value for money and if your budget is tight I can warmheartedly recommend it. And afterwards you will remember it - it is something different like a boutique hotel without the premium price.

Reviews.Title: “quite good”
Reviews.Author: wayan55
Reviews.Content: Perak Hotel is well localized because metro station is not so far. Staff is helfull and we have got the room at 9.30 even if check-in is 14.00. Breakfast also is quite good. Rooms for 3 people on first floor have only a small window and they are dark and a little bit noisy cause works for the new metro.May be is better ask for second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Colleen4154
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great decorations and nice rooms. Very clean and great service. Not much variety in the breakfast but was very nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Lots of character and fantastic hotel! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SORF01
Reviews.Content: There are few hotels in Singapore that have family rooms that will take 2 adults and 2 children but this is one of them (connecting rooms in fact). The hotel is very charming with lovely wooden floors. The rooms are tiny but very clean. We only stayed for a few nights so the size of room did not matter - a two week stay might be a different matter! We arrived very early in the morning with our two small children who were jet lagged and we were offered breakfast whilst one of our rooms (just vacated) was made up very quickly for us (without our asking) so the children could take a nap. The staff were most friendly and very helpful and gave us helpful directions whenever we wanted to go anywhere. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Breakfast was fairly basic but fine (and included in the room price). The hotel is situated in Little India which is quite a fascinating neighbourhood - it is a great place to wander around and take photos. We ate at some excellent restaurants iin the neighbourhood, too. We hesitated about being in Little India but, as this was really the only hotel which was reasonably priced for the dates we were going, we went for it, and did not regret our choice (we were, I think, pleasantly surprised). I would definitely go back - for the same price on our way back through Singapore we stayed in a hotel on Robertsons Quay which was not nearly so nice. You have to pay a lot more along the different quays to get anything like this. Finally, there are a couple of underground stations not too far away so that you can get around the rest of the city without any difficulty (though not easy to find without the excellent directions of the staff!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and customer care”
Reviews.Author: Sar64
Reviews.Content: When searching for hotels, we look for good value, three star, smaller hotels with clean facilities that are in older, more interesting parts of cities and are walkable distances from public transport. Perak Hotel matched these standards but provided so much more that we would highly recommend it to others with similar requirements. We booked a double room which was on 2nd floor (no lift but not a problem for us - no mobility problems). The room was of adequate size, comfortable, equipped with a/c, room safe, ensuite, tv, wardrobe and other basics. (For larger people, the ensuite may be considered too small however it suited us well.) The bed, linen and pillows were all clean and very comfortable with good housekeeping service that maintained the standard set at book-in. There was no view from the window however the room was well lit and leaving the shutters closed permitted us to use the a/c less. Perak Hotel is located in Little India which is a lively, interesting and convenient location in the city. As it is between 2 metro stations on different lines, it offers easy and affordable access to many of the other places that we wished to visit in Singapore. Perak Hotel however is MUCH more than this - it is a gem of care, efficiency and good service for its visitors. During our two-day visit, desk staff were welcoming, effective and well-informed at all times, providing advice and assistance that reflected our particular circumstances, as well as general information. They also pre-empted our possible needs at book-in, with relevant & timely advice such as their luggage storage and shower facilities for book-out day, and their internet access options should we need them for flight confirmations. Other specific examples of their quality service include helping to organise a repair to luggage that had been damaged by the airline; personalising map directions and advice to assist our explorations of the city and attending promptly to an electric buzz sound in the room that was interfering with sleep. While all staff maintained this high standard of service, our personal favourite was the ever-helpful and professional Jaylord - a star of hotel reception staffing. Perak Hotel is for those looking for a hotel that reflects its location and community and also provides wonderful service at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, I'll Always be Back”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyFarFromHome
Reviews.Content: I have stayed over 100 nights at the Perak over the last 3 years. My wife and coworkers have accumulated about that many more nights at different times. This is our prefered hotel when in Singapore on business because the staff is excellent, it is clean and well managed, and we can't find a better value for our money. The location is better suited for tourists than business, but with two MRT stations within walking distance it is convenient for us. The breakfast is reliably good, if basic. The wired Internet is good in the rooms. Wireless is good downstairs and in some rooms. Three floors; no elevator, but I appreciate the exercise. Perhaps most remarkably, there has been almost no turnover in the staff in three years, which must say something good about the management.

Reviews.Title: “clean boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: reshmanooh
Reviews.Content: i had selected this hotel after going thru a whole lot of reviews..and was very tensed if it wud live up to the reviews posted here. we were travelling with our two kids too, and i have to say, it was an excellent choice. clean rooms,bit tiny though..reasonable pricing, filling breakfast, and so safe. we enjoyed exploring little india too..the metro is just 5-10 minutes walk away..loved the place!!

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonesi
Reviews.Content: found this hotel on internet after staying one night at fragrance pearl hotel where we had a horrible stay. the staff at the this hotel (Perak hotel) could not do enough for us, the room was on the ground floor, it was a palace compare to fragrance hotel. nice and quiet for a good nights sleep and breakfast was very good a buffet. on the side walk they have a under cover seating and little tables for smokers or just relaxing. if you want history go for this hotel it was a shop before it was converted to a hotel, its vey old but well looked after

Reviews.Title: “I'd expect this from a backpacker's hostel”
Reviews.Author: SpicyOlio
Reviews.Content: Perak Hotel is a clean and cosy little thing, located within walking distance to Arab Street, Bugis Street as well as the MRTs. There's a Briyani place just next door and another one across the street, and more dotted along the streets nearby, so, rest assured you will not die of hunger anywhere around here. CONS: When we arrived, there was a group of Westerners at the reception. They were treated to welcome drinks of orange juice. Me and my friend got none (we're Malaysians). Is this racism, or did they coincidentally ran out of juice at that time, I don't know. But the feeling was not good. The day before we were supposed to arrive in Singapore, I called Perak Hotel to confirm whether they provide towels and toilettries. YES, the guy on the phone said, BUT PLS BRING YOUR TOOTHPASTE. WE PROVIDE TOOTHBRUSH BUT NOT TOOTHPASTE. I only realized that they did not provide the toothbrushes at 2 am that night, after spending a few hours catching up with my Singaporean friend at Kg. Glam Cafe. So I called the reception and was told that actually, they DON'T provide toothbrushes, ever, but there's a 24-hour convenience store just around the corner where I can get one. Talk about going the extra mile. Thankfully we only stayed there 2 nights, and the only times we had to interact with the aloof staff were when we had to hand in our keys before going out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel in little India”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on a stopover in Singapore. This hotel was smack bang in the middle of little India. This is a pretty good location, and is easy to get around from there. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the room was fine, nothing special, but perfectly suitable and clean. The rooms are a little on the small side, but great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rwtypt
Reviews.Content: Had spotted this hotel on a prior trip and was so looking forward to our stay but room was so noisy and bright with light outside that we got no sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a perfect position”
Reviews.Author: sonianoni
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Little India quarter, only 5 minutes from the subway. The staff is very nice. The breakfast is basic but ok. The rooms are small, it is an ex shophouse, but perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Electricious
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for the Perak Hotel online. Very easy and straight forward. As my partner and I are both very tall, we opted to book the ''Superior Suite'' for extra comfort (as Singaporean hotels are famous for being really small). When we reached the hotel, we were greeted by very friendly staff in a very cozy environment. Initially I was worried about how our stay was going to be, because the gentleman behind the desk requested my credit card used to book the room. Not a problem. It became a problem however when he began writing my card details down on a piece of paper and then turned it over to take note of the security code! At which point, I grabbed my card and suggested paying in cash. The man became quite irate, suggesting this was common practice (as opposed to credit card theft). The next day, I reported the man to the hotel manager, who apologized and bumped us up to the ''Executive Suite.'' We never saw the other guy again. The room we stayed in was very clean and spacious enough for the two of us. The bed was really comfortable, and when we called for extra blankets, the staff brought them right away. Being that the hotel is located in a commercial part of Little India, there were a lot of late night bars and clubs around. The noise wasn't unbearable, but it did make it a bit more difficult to sleep on Friday and Saturday night. Breakfast was as basic as it gets - toast and eggs. That's it. No fruit, no veggies, no cereal. This isn't a problem though as there are tons of restaurants in the area open early and Singaporean food is absolutely amazing. In general, the staff and the hotel service provided were really good. Everyone was extremely friendly. Internet service is provided at no extra cost, but it's really slow. Concerning, cost, value and location, the Perak Hotel is a nice place to stay. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel and expensive, avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: ViLaruccia
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel and very expensive by what if offers, avoid it as it looks like a expensive backpackers hostel (indeed there are more decent hostels that this hotel) we stayed on room 110 GOOD POINTS: Location near 2 MRT stations and free wifi BAD POINTS: room with NO windows, terrible bathroom, air conditioning noise, circuit breaker inside the closet make a lot of noise, bad breakfast, ugly surroundings, uncomfortable beds, rude checking staff There are a lot of other hotel options, that offer better prices and I think better cost/value

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs ruined the expirience.”
Reviews.Author: Travelidea
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was pleasant and the location good...however - stayed in room on the second floor and woke up with bites on my back and thigh. A quick search of the walls by the desk revealed bed bug nymphs crawling freely. Saved some $ on the hotel, but quickly made up for that in $$ having to dry clean my bag and clothing to prevent bringing anything home. Hotel was recommended to me - so perhaps the infestation is only on floor two - but take a word of caution - Check the room before you put your things down or sleep! Not worth the stress of waking up to welts and worry about bringing bugs home.

Reviews.Title: “Little India Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DesertDarling
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel on a noisy street. The front desk staff were very helpful. The breakfast was fair. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Forget sterile Singapore, stay here for a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lacam
Reviews.Content: Its all about location and this is the place to stay to soak up the atmosphere of real Singapore. Great staff and comfortable rooms. OK there are a few niggles such as no hot water for the bathroom sink but you can always boil the kettle! Definitely recommend to friends. Some guests didn't like the early morning prayer call but for us it just added to the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: maturetraveller07
Reviews.Content: Location very central - close to all amenities. Staff wonderful. Accomodation very clean and comfortable. Breakfast perfect. Will definitely stay there again and recommend the Perak Hotel Singapore to all our friends and family. Thank you so much for a very relaxed and enjoyable stay. Marilyn and Michael, Cape Town South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Interesting neighbourhood, nica staff”
Reviews.Author: Sitta
Reviews.Content: The location is good - except for access by taxi, maybe beacuse of road work going on. The staff were very nice and seemed honestly to care about us. The room was nice, but rather small and without windows. Breakfast was perfectly OK and the breakfast room nice. The surroundings are very inetresting. Good place!

Reviews.Title: “Never judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: chillyflavorpopsicle
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks like the rest of Little India (dilapidated) but the rooms are clean and comfortable. They are very small Japanese style rooms with tiny windows and raised bedding area. The bathroom is miniscule with little moving space and patches of mold but usable. At night you hear the air conditioning groaning insistently and the call to prayer. Despite this its a clean, nice hotel that close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyTraveler73
Reviews.Content: While the location just off the main drag of Little India is good, the rooms and service leave a bit to be desired. Staff at check-in and check-out were surly and not too thrilled to answer any questions or proactively offer any assistance. Even my request to reserve a taxi to the airport was met with "you can find one yourself outside." The room was OK - on the small side. Furnishings were on the old side and worn. Bathroom was small. Location is walking distance to the Little India MRT station and the heart of Little India on Serangoon Road. There are also a lot of bars nearby. Overall, I was disappointed. On my next visit to Singapore, I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Traveller555577
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK but we paid $150 each for 2 very small rooms, one windowless. The bathrooms were the smallest I have ever seen so I would say this hotel is very expensive for what you get. Breakfast was nice - a small buffet. Good location in bustling Little India with lots of cheap Indian restaurants and shops. Staff were efficient. The walls were paper thin. We heard all the toilet activities of the man in the next room who sounded like he was vomitting or coughing up something fairly nasty. There was also a family with children squealing and jumping around that was so noisy it was like they were in the room with us. I would rate it 6/10. Certainly nothing like the pictures on their webpage and we were glad we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but take your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: jaccott
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very clean with wonderful staff, who were very efficient and helpful. Although the hotel itself was very quiet, there was considerable noise from the surrounding district, but that is only to be expected with so many bars and restaurants. Our room was certainly OK, but then we only go there to sleep and we felt that the hotel gave good value for money. If you are going to Singapore, get a tourist ticket (3 days max) on the MVR, well worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Villemies
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the good reviews it had gotten and for the fact that it had breakfast in it. Well, if you call having bread and cheese *no ham available, speaking of bacon* breakfast.. this might be your place. Rooms are small, but our airconditioning was broke so we luckily got an upgrade to a better room. Service was specially good from this one guy on the desc! But there is also an old chinese guy who was grumpy, like when we arrived in the evening he was acting busy all the time.. even though there was no single customer (made me wonder if this hotel has some other business than handling the customers). Dont get me wrong, overall this is a good place to stay, but I really think you should get more for 80 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Loumattam
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel. It had character and atmosphere, but the best thing about it by far were the staff who were incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was tiny, which is probably not suprising for Singapore - but we had booked a room with a double and single bed and you could tell that an already small double room had just had an extra single bed put in... And we were traveling with a baby, so throw in a cot and needless to say there wasn't a lot of room! But hey, we were only there to sleep so it didn't matter too much. Speaking of sleep - as much as we loved this hotel, we probably wouldn't recommend it for light sleepers - the hustle of the street started up not long after the early morning call to prayer, so if you're not a morning person and you're bothered by noise, perhaps stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Little india is a great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: avocetexsydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fine place to stay and I would recomend it as it is in the heart of Little india. We enjoyed the advice the night manager gave us about where to eat, Great indian food at very little cost..

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seaswim
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Perak Hotel were very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a superior double room which was great as we like to have the windows open. We did extend our stay and as our room was booked we took a standard room. An okay option, but a lot less light and the windows don't open. You could perhaps find something better for the rate charged. Overall the atmosphere is very relaxing amid the bustle of little india.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: funky2wn
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for 2 nights, but after searching and reading lots of reviews, this place was the best value. The staff were very nice and helpful. I stayed in the deluxe room, and it was clean and tidy. Lots of places to eat around Little India. The free hotel breakfast is very basic and didn't quite hit the spot. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TravellingJamie
Reviews.Content: Very friendly receptionist on arrival, but that was probably just the luck of who I got. Small room, some noise at night, I think from nearby Mosque prayer hours if I remember right. Quite charming little ambience, breakfast fine, location in Little India OK. Internet fine. I paid 150 per night but when I came back a week later to Singapore I managed to get a room at the Elizabeth for same price and Perak did not compare well. I would also say Perak seems very expensive at that price by European standards, even in New York or Paris or London I would not rate this as good value. Not sure if Singapore is really more expensive than all those if I overpaid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, Friendly staff, Charming hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: anudada
Reviews.Content: Inspite of being located in a budget location, the hotel manages to retain charm and character. Nice, comfortable and clean hotel with warm decor. We had two rooms - one triple and one standard. The triple room was styled in the local Peranakan style with beds on a raised platform. A good change from regular rooms. The standard room was slightly small but not congested. Both rooms had small windows, but that did not bother us since we only came to the rooms to sleep at night. The superior rooms have big windows. Courteous and friendly staff ever-ready to help you out with any concerns/requests you might have. The breakfast was completely vegetarian and is quite basic. Excellent location for budget travellers. Close to two MRTs - Little India and Bugis. Bus stop is a 1-min walk away . Close to budget shopping areas - Mustafa/Little India and Bugis Street. Lots of eateries and backpacker pubs closeby. All in all a great stay. Would definitely recommend to others looking for an inexpensive hotel in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and good value to stay”
Reviews.Author: HirimNurliana
Reviews.Content: A very lovely little hotel. We stayed 5 days and really felt satisfied. Everything was very good, my room was clean, spacious and well equipped. the staff was helpful, they were so kind to give us all things we ask for. We were almost comfortable but a little noise from the reception area where my room was near. We had a nice stay in Perak, however.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eliasaroth
Reviews.Content: At Perak hotel we were welcomed by very friendly staff that give you something to drink while you fill out the necicary forms. The room itself is clean and has a big nice bed. The bathroom was like any other bathroom in a "low cost" hotel. I was plesantly surprised that the shower had a rather high water pressure, something I did not see often on my trip. The hotel is located halfway between two metro stops...Little India and Bugis. Very convinient to go to and from the airport. We only stayed one night at this hotel this time, but will probably stay there again next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: jonniepalmer
Reviews.Content: Location Right in the heart of little India. Surrounded with great low cost places to eat. Prince William bar right next door. On the flip side you might get awoken by an early morning call to prayer. A few dollars in a taxi will get you to the middle of the city. Value Ok I suppose for Singapore. Still for the upgraded room (only available) was ~£100 per night. Rooms No views to outside but good quality and clean. We had a very strong air freshener in our wardrobe which when found went straight out of the room! Breakfast. Good quality self service. Toast, cereal, eggs and proper coffee! other oh and free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: trimria
Reviews.Content: it is very simple to be independant at this hotel. it's easy to get to and from the airport. we stayed in the penthouse family suite which was wonderfully spacious if you don't mind the stairs. the local restaurants were reasonably priced and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms quite small and dark”
Reviews.Author: Fimum
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and greeted us with a cool juice on arrival, the room was quite elegantly furnished but very small for three. We had only two tiny windows up near the ceiling, so no view to the street. The air conditioning was welcome though and the free wi-fi was good. The sleeping platform that had mattresses rather than beds up on it was a bit awkward to use. I liked Little India and was happy with the location, a very interesting part of Singapore. the hotel is pretty on the outside but I don't think was good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean Rooms, Noisy Area”
Reviews.Author: nnmartin
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing! Very kind and helpful. The rooms were tiny, but had everything you needed and clean. I liked the little common area with free WIFI and coffee. My only complain was that it was very noisy. I don't recommend staying on the ground floor where you could be near the reception and kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in interesting part of singapore”
Reviews.Author: JaneLittle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. The room was a standard room - very small window but good size room, very clean with comfortable beds and small but functional bathroom. We would stay again. The area is fascinating with food hall and train station in easy walking distance. People were lovely and let us store our bags and relax in the lounge area after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever!”
Reviews.Author: zoozooma
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Perak Hotel is very well located in the heart of Singapore. And yes, the staff is more than friendly, nontheless this was one of the worst hotels we´ve ever been to during our worldtrip. Rooms are tiny, the standard room didn´t even have a proper window. Besides bathrooms are tiny and in average condition and due to it´s location, it has been very noisy around the clock. Compared to other hotels in major cities at this price scale, the Perak isn´t competitive at all.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest place in a messy district”
Reviews.Author: Russell2007
Reviews.Content: Perak hotel does not look like much from the outside, just an ordinary structure of a building. But once you step in, it's clear that care has been taken to maintain the place to appeal to both business and leisure travelers. The staff at the front desk is polite and courteous. They are locally well connected and can suggest ways in which you can enhance your itinerary. They were nice enough to offer me a discount for extending my stay by an additional 2 nights even though they were fairly well occupied. The complimentary breakfast on offer is so-so with most of the options being stuff you can buy at the local 7-11 stores. Pick a table near the little pool filled with Koi fish, as the sound of water provides a soothing effect compared to the noise of Little India around the corner. The view from the windows is best avoided as the district is one of the cheaper ones to stay in for good reason. I'm not sure what to make of the pricing as we visited when the PGA tour was on and rates of all establishments had been hiked up. But I found it just about worth the price although I will hope they upgrade some of the amenities they provide guests with on my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel: lovely staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: bananapain
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Perak Hotel for a long weekend on stopover to UK. Everything about this place was good and most things were excellent. The highlights were the lovely staff - every single one of them was friendly and keen to go the extra mile to help (especially Jaylord who's smiling self we were pleased to see every evening), and the location right on the edge of Little India, easy walking to plenty of other areas and the MRT. The room was also good - small but reasonable size by Singapore standards, clean, good bed, big wardrobe. Breakfast was fine - cereal, fresh fruit salad, toast and jams/peanut butter etc, pieces of omelet, rice/noodles, cake, tea/coffee/juices - plenty to start the day. We'll def stay here again if we're back in the city. Not 5* but does what it does great.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value and pretty dingy”
Reviews.Author: ZebulonUk
Reviews.Content: Fairly small clean rooms, poor quality breakfast, austere service and very dingy. Location is quite good in the middle of little India, however for the money there must be better options than this in Singapore with better service and room furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Little India”
Reviews.Author: timpaws
Reviews.Content: We loved the Perak Hotel, ideally located for exploring Little India and the Arabic district and not too far from the closest MRT (Bugis, 10 stops from the airport). Having said this, the hotel is on a quiet road with no through traffic yet it's on the edge of these thriving and vibrant communities with their great places to eat. Reception staff were very friendly, provided a welcome drink on arrival and voluntarily upgraded our room. Buffet breakfast was a relaxed affair and a more than sufficient selection and quantity was available. We felt the little boutique touches like quiet meditative areas, a water feature and unique traditional styling made the Perak worthy of mention. We only stayed for one night but would easily have extended our visit if we'd had more time.

Reviews.Title: “Character and Charm in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Ombudsman
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights in February and had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and charming. I recommend staying in Little India rather than someplace more generic. Room was nice but small. Tucked in the interior and very quiet. Breakfast was fine, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: OursDispo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night between a flight and a cruise. Received a very warm and amical welcome from the reception. Room was small cozy and quiet. Exactly what we expected. The breakfast was excellent. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for just passing through down for a couple nights only”
Reviews.Author: orange_crush6
Reviews.Content: Check in- was easy, although I did have to wait 1 hour at 4pm because my room had not been cleaned yet. Room- had all the basics. It was small, good for one person, had good working AC, hot shower, and was clean. The only complaint I have is the noise...you can here the people above you walking around and the bar near the hotel. perks- free breakfast in the morning and free internet at night. The food was good... service- the front desk people are nice location- it's in little india and within walking distance to the MRT, restaurants, ATM, and supermarket. There is a mosque down the street so be ready for the 5:45am wake up call. I would not stay here again, would probably pay more to stay in a resort, but I would recommend it to those that are staying here for a couple nights or on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all. Great service smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: canerandagio
Reviews.Content: I can't really give an informed opinion here because it is possible that all rooms in Singapore are small, so ours felt like that... However, if we gloss over this point, everything else about this middle of the road hotel is quite good. Location is in Little India (far from the modern shopping areas of Singapore, but near the beautiful Indian quarter). You can't be near everything in Singapore, so all considered this was good for us. The MRT station and buses are all minutes away. Service was outstanding, although you don't get a porter nor valet parking, you get a guy at a desk, a very helpful guy providing all the info you need about the island. Free internet at night, free coffee throughout the day, breakfast included even if we hadn't paid for it. A relaxing area cut out of a busy Indian street, beautiful shrines scattered around the floors to make the place look good make this hotel a recommendable choice, notwithstanding the price which is probably beatable nearby. As said the rooms are smallish but they come with all the bits you want, including TV and aircon, as well as toiletries etc. Keep your expectations low and you'll be seriously pleased, raise them a bit too high and you may be disappointed. No pool, gym, sauna, if that's what you're after...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,friendly and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: magicmart
Reviews.Content: Location perfect with a choice of MRT stations or a short walk to Burgis Street. Being in the middle of Little India says it all, spicy smells, gaudy colours and hustle,bustle and noise but we never felt intimidated and the locals were extremely polite. Go for the superior room, but take earplugs for a good nights sleep every night. Breakfast more than adequate, Wi-Fi Signal variable in our room but good in reception area. Reception and cleaning staff excellent and good price for what you receive. Get a EZ-link Card good for buses, the MRT and LRT, you purchase the cards from any TransitLink Ticket Office it costs 5S$ to rent the card but all unused monies are refunded, it is so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: im44
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at the smallness of the "Superior" room (309) and larger cost. Internet connection was spotty or weak at best - though it was supposed to be good. Mosque down the road called to prays at 5:30 was our alarm clock. Bar next door kept going until 4:30 every night we were there - so we got maybe 1 hr sleep. Airport taxi was S$35 - and we were at Changi in about 25 min. Nothing free not even a bottle of water. 7/11 around the corner. BUT it was clean, convenient and most staff, especially Jaylord were helpful & knowledgeable.Midway between MRT stations, close to bus station. new Restaurant - 7 Sensations, just around the block was excellent for a vege place. Keep your expectations in check and Perak is ok - remember Singapore is expensive and crowded. Breakfast is included... even a hot choice.

Reviews.Title: “Character and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: KevinF_NZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, plus our two daughters stayed at the Perak Hotel for 2 nights. We had connecting rooms on the second floor. We arrived from the airport via MRT at Bugis station and walked from there. We arrived looking hot and bothered, so the receptionist poured us glasses of juice. Very welcome, I can tell you! Although we were there at 9 am, our rooms were free and they kindly let us settle in early. That gave a chance for weary travellers to sleep off some of the jet lag. The rooms are small, but as others have noted, clean and kept cool. There is plenty of space in the wardrobe for getting the bags out of the way. The breakfast is only adequate, with instant coffee being the primary disappointment. Free wireless internet was excellent - all hotels should be providing this as a basic service, so well done Perak! We were in Little India during Diwali, so there was certainly plenty of bustle and colour in the area. The noise in the wee hours from the nearby nightclub was loud and something I could've done without. The hotel was well-located to get to the Singapore Zoo, Jurong Bird Park and Sentosa using the Singapore Attractions Express bus (SAEx). It stops at Tekka Mall (now known as The Verge) and goes directly to those popular destinations. The best things? Friendly staff, characterful building, great location. The not-so-good things? Quite pricey, nearby noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “A Low-key Gem in Little India”
Reviews.Author: friskycelery
Reviews.Content: Even though I arrived after midnight, I was given a friendly welcome at this small, privately owned hotel. And, even better, there was bottled water and cans of cold beer in the room's mini-fridge! The Perak Hotel is spotlessly clean, and in an interesting location. There is a mosque about half a block away, and I heard the call to prayer every morning when I woke up. There are several good and inexpensive restaurants in the area; I particularly recommend Bismillah Biryani. The Bugis MRT stop is a short walk away, as is Bugis Street. Sim Lim Square - nirvana for electronics geeks - is just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: Justsixty
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel and marvel at those that are very positive. For me, this was a poor choice and the room was at the lower level with virtually no windows (even though I specifically asked for full windows). The receptionist seemed quite vague and to suggest that the breakfast is anything more than the basics is quite untrue. We were there on Sunday and Monday night and the first night there was a racket going on until the early hours of the morning. We were glad to leave and all the hotels we used for the next 2 weeks were fantastic in comparison. I say this to make it clear that I am not difficult to please, but I do recognise poor quality when I see it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are most kind, to the point of becoming friends”
Reviews.Author: MarcoSolo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for those interested in sightseeing Little India. On a more secluded street, a quieter haven from its bustling core. The staff are sweet and most kind, to the point of becoming friends. Helpful in finding good places to eat and drink. Rooms are clean, tidy and of generous size for the solo traveller or couple. A leisurely six minute walk to Little India MRT places you within minutes of the rest of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Best combo of comfort, convenience, value”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyFarFromHome
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and personable hotel staff. Great little breakfast buffet. Good WiFi. Clean rooms. Located between two MRT stations, so easy access to everywhere. Surrounded by a tremendous variety of food and shopping, ranging from upscale to the local ethnic markets. Out the door to the left if you want to walk the streets of Little India; to the right if you want modern Singapore. I have stayed at a variety of hotels in Singapore and around the world. When in Singapore, my wife and I usually stay at the Perak because it offers the right combination of value, comfort, and interesting surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, Nightclub noise and building site next door.”
Reviews.Author: Kalidev
Reviews.Content: The best thing about it is the location, great indian food nearby and I loved visiting the different indian temples. We asked for a quiet room and the small superior room seemed quiet by day (Friday afternoon). At night the booming beats of an indian dance club were too audible, we might have checked it out, but needed to catch a flight the next early morning... Then I noticed this bug, thought it looks like a bed bug, sure enough it was one and we found more... We got a transfer to the basement room, which was less noisy and had no bed bugs. We still had a hard time falling asleep triple checked on bugs and it was still noisy until at least 2 am. I did only hear once noise from the building site, which was about ten meters up the road, but it is pretty close... The breakfast was very simple continental. Did not check the internet, but a guy was trying for an hour to get the wireless connection to work (in the breakfast room near the modem). Anyways, now I know how bed bugs look like and I was lucky enough to notice them before we fell asleep.

Reviews.Title: “A great bolthole for seeing Singapore, cosy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bibimichael
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed two nights in a suite in the Nirwana Beach Hotel in Bintan, Indonesia, our initial reaction to our deluxe triple room in the Perak Hotel was not very positive. The room was cramped with a double, a single and a baby cot. We stayed in room 302 which is the biggest room they have. My husband had to do some work an a presentation he was doing the next day and was worried that the room would not be conducive to this with two adults, one child and a baby all cooped up together, the only alternative would be that we would all have to go out of the day and leave him alone to get on with it. However, the staff were extremely helpful and suggested that he worked downstairs in their lobby area after breakfast had been packed away. They made sure he could work undisturbed on his laptop and he had no problems with the WiFi connection in the lobby although we did have connection problems in our room. You won't get a huge buffet breakfast with 'live cooking stations' and a selection of food from every corner of the globe like you do in higher grade hotel but you will get an adequate selection of bread, pandan cakes, cereal, eggs, noodles, beans, cheese, that kind of thing. I suggested that they varied the selection a bit though for people staying for more than a couple of nights need a bit of variety. The real bonus is the location. A plus point if you love Indian food, you can dine on delicious curries until the early hours of the morning. If you like to wash it down with a pint of 2 of cask ale, The Prince of Wales pub does some great beers off the pump. A real bonus for curry loving, ale loving Brits like us. Yes, the staff on the desk did seem a bit concerned that we weren't paying up front and I'm not used to doing this when checking into a hotel, but they certainly weren't rude of standoffish to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CyclingDan
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked to stay here for three nights in May 09. This was a really great place to stay, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “if you need the internet service forget about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vladibologna
Reviews.Content: if you need the internet service forget about this hotel, I am stayingh here from 05th March 2009 and each day there are some problems with the connection, also in the common area. The staff is smiling, saying - "I am sorry" but the problems is not solved from two days. From the hotel you are paying 145 SGD you would await the better service. The breakfest is very poor, and the same each day. If you are booking tghe room try to book without the breakfest, is more better to go outside. Tomorrow I am going to change to Albert Court and I will write my review w.bandelak

Reviews.Title: “Loved ease of everything”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely pleasant and checked my in very quickly, even for the late hour of my arrival. The room was small but was expected to be so... Two beds and a long, narrow table (which does not leave much room to spread out) comprised the room. Bathroom had little water pressure and absolutely no countertop for toiletries. BUT, the price was great and the breakfast buffet was better than expected. One note: my room's bathroom floor was slightly lower than the rest of the room. I continually stubbed my toes on the small, three inch ledge - so watch out! Overall, great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esperanto-uk
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here two times before, we are thinking of a change next time. It is not cheap & some packages offer better value, though this hotel does have atmosphere. But we just want somewhere to crash between flights. Staff are friendly & arrange taxis etc quickly. Love walking around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: NasiG0reng
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Perak Lodge was very enjoyable. We are not sure about the other staff members but Jaylord at the front desk was top notch. He was extremely friendly and helpful. He answered all of our questions thoroughly, even taking the time to print out MRT maps. The room was very clean and had a lot of character. The breakfast consisted of bread, muffins, mixed fruits, eggs, cereal, juice, and coffee. Although the price is a bit above average, it is not that bad compared to all the other places in singapore. The only bad thing that can be said about perak is the location. if you are lazy and do not like to walk 5-10min to the bus or train station, you will be irritated. WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND PERAK LODGE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Windfreak
Reviews.Content: Finding decent priced accommodation in Singapore is quite difficult without having to stay in a hostel. Fortunately I came across the Perak and decided to take a chance not really knowing what to expect. I am very happy to say that we were delighted with the choice. We stayed there for 3 nights before travelling in Indonesia and Malaysia and for another 2 nights after. The rooms are very comfortable - we didn't take the cheapest but middle range. All rooms have modern flat screen tvs and a well stocked minibar plus coffee/tea and pot noodles if you wish to have them. Downstairs in the breakfast area there is complimentary tea, coffee , hot chocolate and biscuits all day long. The room was extremely comfortable with a safe in the room too. the bathroom was very clean but looked like it needed a bit of TLC, but having said that we found that the bathrooms all over the areas we went to in SE Asia were a little bit below standard. The staff were excellent and extremely helpful. We needed to book our daughter in for an extra night after we left and they were very accommodating giving us a special price and a very nice room too. We were also very happy to see that they upgraded our room on our return. This was a really super room, quite large and a decent sized bathroom too. Breakfast is very good and sufficient with quite a variety of food which you can take as much as you want of. Leaving your luggage after checking out is no problem at all cos they will store it for you at no extra charge. There is also internet facilities. The location in Little India is great fun. Close to some great restaurants (try the Banana Leaf Apollo - brilliant Indian food!) and also great for shopping. If you like walking you can easily walk to alot of attractions around and is just round the corner from Sim Lim Sq where you can get great electronics. Location is excellent. If I have to visit Singapore again I would definitely stay at the same place and highly recommend it to anyone looking for good budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Dev
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night on a transit to Australia. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help. Check-in & check-out were quick. We were given a room on the ground floor just next to the restaurant. We thought we would have problems with noice but we had a peaceful night. The standard room was small in size, but the room & batthroom were very clean. All the basic items were available in the room. As you know, hotels are very expensive in Singapore so I can't complain about the room size. It's more than adequate for one night stay. The breakfast was basic. Although our connecting flight at 6pm, we had to check-out at 12 as per the hotel policy. Otherwise, we had to pay for an extra day. On checking-out at 12 noon, the staff kindly kept our luggage in a safe place in the hotel. They also made some suggestions to spend our spare time i Singapore. In addition, they also arranged a taxi for us to go to the airport. We are happy with the hotel and the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....noisy location”
Reviews.Author: wonderwend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Perak for a few nights in November. The staff at reception are very friendly and they were very accommodating with our requests for a quiet room. Our room was very small but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also very small but everything worked as it should. On our first night at the hotel we went to bed at about midnight but were unable to sleep due to the night club that is just around the corner. At 3am we went down to reception and they very kindly moved us to a ground floor room that has no windows. This room was much quieter. The breakfast at the hotel was very nice and staff serving breakfast were friendly. Overall we had a nice time at the Perak and the problems that we had were not the fault of the hotel but rather due to the location. We felt that prices for the Perak were quite high..but again this is not the fault of the hotel but down to the demand for accommodation in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: papupu
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Perak. If you're looking for a hotel with more personality than your typical chain and don't want to stay with a bunch of rowdy kids on break, it should work for you. Note that rooms are on the small side. We followed Lonely Planet's advice and requested room 302, which faces the street and is their biggest outside their triples. We paid a lower rate and got upgraded to it when we arrived and no one had booked it. If they have it, get it. Staff was helpful, if a tad professional. Bathrooms were clean, but again, don't expect a claw-foot tub. AC worked fine. Little India neighborhood was interesting, as you were away from the skyscrapers and heavily-touristed Chinatown, but felt like you were in cool place of its own. Noise of mosque didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mikebaxter_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Perak for 5 days , 4 nights , from 6th to10th oct 2008. Having read some of the negative reviews about the place I was a little bit apprehensive before arriving there. I needn`t have worried though as the hotel was very good.My room , 208 ,was a standard room, but very clean.The room was serviced every day and the bed linen was changed every day. The only slight negative with the room was that the window was high up against the ceiling, well above head height and so it had no view. The room had air con, tv, tea making facilities and the shower/ bathroom was fine.The water wasnt hot but was adequate in the heat of Singapore !! I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was enough to start the day. A tip on flushing the toilet would be to keep the button pressed in as long as necessary. For a better than average budget hotel ,I would recommend the Perak

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBeeKL
Reviews.Content: This is really a gem of a place. Reminded me a lot of quaint BnB's in the UK. The place is really value for money. The rooms are nice although a little small. Very very clean though. The reception and sitting area is very pretty and pleasing to the eye. Breakfast menu is limited but good and cooked fresh when you want it. I thought it was a good place and will recommend it to anyone. The location is also quite central althought the nearest MRT is a bit of a walk but nothing to impossible. Nice, lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but do not rent the loft rooms/apartments”
Reviews.Author: cwolf22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our family with 2 kids aged 4 and 5 on a stopover on our way to Bali. Before we had kids, we had stayed here a couple of times in standard/superior rooms. As we were looking for 2 bedroom accomodation, which is very hard to find in Singapore!, we were happy that the Perak Hotel could provide us with a loft apartment with a little kitchen with 2 bedrooms. It costed SGD 415 (roughly EUR 200) per night. Even taking into account that Singapore accomodation is very expensive, we found the value for this accomodation okay, but we had some problems. On the positive side, the loft was rather large. On the negative side, almost all light bulbs were not working, almost no water came from the shower and the hotel's archive was being kept in the loft! Also, the kitchen was very minimal and the service not too friendly. So next time, I prefer to rent 2 interlocking "normal" rooms at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Perak Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: louisev1982
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Perak Hotel! We stayed there for one night in August 2008. The rooms are on the small side but look lovely (hard woorden floors, great eye for detail, huge television) and the location is great. We walked to a bunch of sights in Singapore from the hotel, which was very doable. The breakfast is pretty great too! Great assortment of bread, cakes, jam and even peanutbutter. Not a huge assortment of eggs and so on, but I didnt really miss that. Last but not least: free internet at night, a decent book exchange and free luggage storage. Especially considering the price (we paid 198 singapore dollar for a superior double- the standard doubles only have a skylight, no windows) its a very good choice and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Decent deal in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a group tour. Hotel room is small and generally expensive for what you get. bathroom was very small and plumbing leaked. Service okay. Would not stay here long but for a quick overnight it is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: rvswindle
Reviews.Content: The Perak Hotel is a very pleasant, inexpensive hotel. The hotel is described in one travel book as a backpackers type of place, but this was not our impression at all. Our room, although small, was very clean and comfortable, and had a good TV and a small refrigerator, plus a very clean, small bathroom. The bed was firm and the room was furnished with some interesting pieces of furniture. The air-conditioning worked well, which is not a small thing in Signapore. The breakfast was quite good, with toast and fried eggs, fresh fruit and yogurt and cereal. Also, there was a free internet computer station. The front desk personnel were efficient and helpful, and offered us a glass of fruit juice when we arrrived. When we needed an early taxi to the train station, the front desk person arranged it quickly. The whole place is clean and well-run. Note that the rooms are at different levels of comfort, and we stayed in a deluxe room, which is the most expensive. I do not know what the other levels are like. However, our room was a very good value for expensive Singapore. This hotel is located in Little India, and is reasonably close to a subway station, as well as good Indian restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: esmeLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at The Perak on our way back from Bali at the beginning of this month. Had no problems with the hotel when we complained the air con was noisy and I mean noisy they moved us asap. The hotel was clean comfy breakfast was simple but adequate and the staff polite and helpful I would stay there again if I was in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: love-asia-hate-perak
Reviews.Content: For a hundred quid a night I did not expect to be shouted at and treated like a second-class citizen.
