My friend and I had 2 nights in singapore and decided to splash out and spend a bit of money. Every member of staff was rude and unhelpful and we would have laughed, were we not paying a lot for this privelige. I left photos of my wedding out in the room and the cleaner threw them away. When I was very upset and asked reception for help the duty manager said 'It's not my problem' then when i asked to speak to the manager he refused to be put on the phone. This hotel is run by cowboys. GO ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and close to all”
Reviews.Author: KylzOz
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find budget accomodation in Singapore and Perak was reasonably priced compared to other hotels. Just inside Little India near a few backpackers places. Staff very accommodating and friendly. Rooms were clean and were serviced daily with fresh linens, towels etc. Our only gripe is that we didn't seem to get any hot water in the shower. This wasn't a major issue as it was always hot in singapore but just a bit of warmth in the shower would have been good.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: gempk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Perak Hotel for three nights on the first stop of our round-the-world trip. It was a great start. It's a renovated shophouse of 35 rooms in Little India - a location we chose for a not-so-Western experience of Singapore, that is still very accessible via the nearby Little India MRT station to the other precincts like Orchard Road, the river, etc. We had booked a standard room but had it upgraded for free to superior. We loved the presentation of the hotel, from the polished floorboards to the blue painted shutters and the view from the stairwell landing windows of the brightly coloured buildings of Little India. (We could even hear an evening call to prayer from a nearby temple!) It is very clean. The airconditioning is very effective and makes the Perak Hotel a true oasis after a long day's sightseeing! Breakfast was included, served in the lovely breakfast room, and was mainly continental offerings but with some Singaporean elements, like kaya (Singapore's answer to marmalade, made of egg and coconut). If you are used to a hot shower like me, you will find that the shower in the room is quite tepid even on the highest temperature setting, but I found this to be a positive in fact - it is very refreshing in the humidity and stops the bathroom from fogging up. The bed was comfortable, though on the firm side. The other caveat I would offer is that there is no lift, so if you have mobility problems, you may struggle with the stairs. The only small gripes were that there was no soap provided in the bathroom at all (but this was easily overcome), and that the wireless internet in our room dropped out from time to time. We would definitely stay at the Perak Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JHinLondon
Reviews.Content: It's a pretty little hotel and it's in a good location with good access to the metro on the airport line and the other sights of Singapore. But the negatives outweighed the positives: - It was an absolutely tiny room. Two people might fit - but not with luggage! - Noisy. Oh my goodness so noisy. Our upstairs neighbours were checking out 4.30 am so for over an hour from 3.30am it sounded like a herd of elephants trampling on our ceiling. - Customer service was lousy. Very unfriendly staff who made us feel like we were interrupting them when we checked in. Also, I rang the desk at 4am asking if they could ask our upstairs neighbours to be a bit more quiet but their response was 'they're checking out soon'. Fine if you've got nowhere better to stay but I'd say look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan_irth501
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a stopover and was reasonably impressed with the rooms and service, although I noticed another customer seemed to have trouble checking in. Rooms were lovely although wooden floors meant you could sometimes hear others walking around. I would recommend this hotel for those on a budget who would prefer something different to the average chain hotel. The location is fine for getting to attractions as the MRT is just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Steffal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Perak Hotel in February 2008 as we had booked a stopover in Singapore on our way to Bali. On our arrival they told us, that we got upgraded because they had no more rooms in the category we booked. The room was just special and wonderful. Over some stairs you reached the two beds, we also had flatscreen and a nice bathroom. The service was great and very polite, even though the breakfast ist really a little simple. But that doesn't matter, you have lots of stores and restaurants around and the Indian Paan is always worth to eat it ;) From the hotel you also have a good connection to the subways and all sights. The value for money is awesome! I can highly recommend the hotel for your stopover in Singapore! Another nice thing: I forgot my jacket and a sweater there and the staff is so kind to ship it back - great service..!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Frances_Milner
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights en route to Lombok and then again coming back. Pretty boutique hotel. Smallish but adequate rooms - spotlessly clean. No frills (pool etc) , but then you are not paying for them either. Very convenient location, just 5 minutes amble to Little India MRT station, and taxis and buses available closer still just at the bottom of the road. and bang in the middle of Little India so bars and restaurants all around anyway. Nice breakfast, very welcoming, helpful and friendly staff. Very good value for money, highly recommended. Possible down sides - rooms and corridors have beautiful wooden floors so there is potential for noise from other guests and also there is some street noise - neither bothered us, but if you are a light sleeper you should maybe take earplugs. Also there is no lift - we were on 3rd floor, and again didn't bother us, but others may feel differently.

Reviews.Title: “Great, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: xiao-heilong
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Perak Hotel everytime I go to Singpoare for nearly 8 years. I always book a deluxe room, so I can't comment on the other room types. It is the mix of old colonial charm and the modern conveniences like wireless broadband that I really like about this hotel. The wooden floor-boards, old style windows and facade of the hotel remind me I'm in Southeast Asia - something the bigger places on Orchard Road don't do. Over the years the staff now recognise me, and I have always found the service friendly enough - and very helpful. Given that Singapore is not a budget travel destination, I find the room rate very reasonable for what you get and will always recommend it to friends. The location in Little India is great, very close to the MRT, Queen St bus terminal, great food and plenty of atmosphere on a Sunday. A unique hotel in a great area of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with personality”
Reviews.Author: PerthAusTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Perak Hotel for four days in mid April 2007. We booked directly with the hotel, and even then still managed to get a superior room for only S$148 a night. The bed was rock hard, the bathroom was tiny and the breakfast was quite basic. The only other negative was the three flights of stairs we had to climb with suitcases, as they are small enough not to need a lift. These aren't big things though, and there were plenty of great points as well - a five minute walk (if that) to the Little India MRT, a 1 minute walk to a 7 Eleven store, minutes to many places to eat and it was a hotel with personality - after 2 days there, we were recognised by staff and greeted by our names. The air conditioning is a must have in Singapore, and the staff service was also fantastic. There is a big difference between a small hotel like this, and one of the larger ones I have stayed in here before. You're treated like a number at the larger ones, and the Perak made me feel like a guest, not a customer. I'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Perak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skink
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Perak Hotel in March 2007. It was just a one night stopover but was pretty disappointing. The hotel bills itself as a boutique property, but there's realy not much to it with the exception of a few antiques in the hallway. The rooms are small, the bathroom shower is just above the sink so everything gets wet. Breakfast is mediocre at best and the hotel staff is not all that helpful when it comes to late check-outs. The locaton is good, in Little India, and its just a few blocks from the Metro station. Other than being convenient to Little India, the hotel has little to offer. I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities for the price”
Reviews.Author: globedecker
Reviews.Content: If you want a first class or corporate hotel in a nondescript cityscape, then stay away from the Perak, instead book at one of the glass and concrete boxes on Orchard Road. The Perak is not like the big chain hotels but is a great value for the money in Singapore. For around $70USD per night you get a clean (albiet small) room, with basic but nice appointments(Cable TV, A/C, DVD, free wireless internet, etc), a good location in vibrant Little India, and basic but tasty buffet breakfast. I had no complaints other than a bit of street noise late at night when a neaby bar was closing up. But the cheapest rooms at the Perak have a skylight rather than a window and are much quieter if noise is an issue

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbertsCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Perak Hotel on two occasions during 2006. Found the location very convenient with easy access to downtown Singapore. The building itself is very nice both inside and out, think it might have been one of the old chinese style clan houses, nicely decorated on the inside and is in keeping with the traditional style. Had a look at a few different rooms, the sizes do vary. All were very clean and comfortable. Breakfast served on the ground floor, very tasty buffet style with plenty of coffee tea and juice. The staff were great, really helpful with advice on what to do while in Singapore and the best ways to get around. Would gladly return to Perak Hotel next time I visit Singapore. A real alternative to the big international hotels. Has the personal touch lacking in bigger establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: stedan66
Reviews.Content: After reading the comments on tripadvisor and a call to the hotel I booked 2 deluxe-rooms via the hotel's homepage. On calling they told me that only deluxe-rooms are free. My mistake, I didn't do attention to the confirmation email, they confirmed 2 standard-rooms. We arrived at midnight and was very disappointed about the standard-rooms, very small, no windows, only air-con and no internet, the good thing about the rooms: they are clean. Next day I checked the deluxe-rooms, but finally for this price I don't agree and we changed the hotel. Paying only 40 SD more we've in very well four star hotel now. The perak hotel staff is very friendly, they offered deluxe-rooms and did no problems about our hotel change.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with 'the indipendent': one of the best budget hotel in the world.”
Reviews.Author: valemaffy
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in the indian part of singapore. Our room was clean, comfortable and nice, staff was kind and helpfull, for only 60 euro with breakfast. In the surroundig you'll find resturant, shops, underground and a shopping center. This hotel is also advised by "the indipendent" as "on of the best budget hotel in the world" and I agree with them!
